qas.question: The history of Jews in Greece goes back to which era?
Which Greek historian knew of the Jews?
What did the Greek historian Herodotus refer to the Jews as?
The Greek historian Herodotus listed the Jews as the levied naval forces in service to whom?
The Synagogue in the Agora of Athens is dated to the period between which two dates?

context: The history of Jews in Greece goes back to at least the <a0_0>Archaic Era of Greece<a0_0/>, when the classical culture of Greece was undergoing a process of formalization after the Greek Dark Age. The Greek historian <a1_0>Herodotus<a1_0/> knew of the Jews, whom he called <a2_0>"Palestinian Syrians"<a2_0/>, and listed them among the levied naval forces in service of <a3_0>the invading Persians<a3_0/>. While Jewish monotheism was not deeply affected by Greek Polytheism, the Greek way of living was attractive for many wealthier Jews. The Synagogue in the Agora of Athens is dated to the period between <a4_0>267 and 396 CE<a4_0/>. The Stobi Synagogue in Macedonia, was built on the ruins of a more ancient synagogue in the 4th century, while later in the 5th century, the synagogue was transformed into Christian basilica.
